product_name: CLINIQUE Chubby Stick Cheek Colour Balm
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Auburn', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_content:
I loved the Sephora gel blushes, especially in the “Dahlia” shade (which is basically a berry). They were sheer and natural looking, but also long lasting. Apparently Sephora doesn’t make those anymore, and I couldn’t find another liquid blush that seemed right, so I tried this. Definitely a higher price point, but I’ve been very happy with this in the “Plumped Up Peony” shade. It seems like a lot when it goes on, but it blends easily and looks very natural. I agree with some people that it doesn’t really last all day, but I don’t think it completely fades away either.

product_name: CLINIQUE Chubby Stick Cheek Colour Balm
user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content: I’m 63 and prefer creamy blush over powders and stains. Creams can be tricky. This one is very pigmented, so when you apply it there is a nice intense base to be blended out. product_name: CLINIQUE Chubby Stick Cheek Colour Balm
review_content: the chubby stick blush is a unique and convenient way to apply blush wherever you are. pigmented and blendable so it leaves you with a natural flush that lasts all day. it comes with a lot of product and will honestly last you ages! would definitely recommend

product_name: CLINIQUE Chubby Stick Cheek Colour Balm
user_specs: ['Age 18-24', 'Skin Type Combination', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Eye Color Brown']
review_content:
I dare say that this Chubby Stick is my absolute favorite cosmetic anywhere! If I had time to put on only a single item, I would definitely choose this. The portability and ease of application can't be beat! For a doll-like cheek, add two hearts/dots of blush on the apples and blend out very gently with your fingers, or for a really subtle blush, add three dots going up toward your temple and blend upward. It's hard to make a mistake with this blush because of how creamy and blendable it is, but you can keep it highly pigmented too. $23 is a reasonable price; I've used this every day for 2 years and still have not run out. If you have warm-toned skin, robust rhubarb gives a healthy, natural coral-peach glow with just a hint of shimmer/sheen.

review_content:
I used to have very oily skin and avoided creamy blushes. Now as I've gotten older and my skin is more normal/dry, I am enjoying cream blushes/stains. I got the amp'd up apple color in the glam camp set and it is perfect for my light skin. I have a lot of bright berry colored stains that are very flattering on me but I think this one is my fave for a flattering everyday look. It blends well and is buildable but I don't need to much. Just gives my cheeks a glow and sheen that is so flattering. I don't find it hard to blend but it is best on recently exfoliated and freshly moisturized skin. Also, wouldn't recommend for those with very oily or very dry skin. Will try more colors.

review_content: Love it. It looks absolutely natural and colour is perfect for my skin. I have normal/dry skin and this is very moisturising.

product_name: CLINIQUE Chubby Stick Cheek Colour Balm
review_content:
Oh, I just love this balm. I don't have an issue with powder blush and I don't necessarily prefer cream over powder, or vice versa. I wanted to give this a try mainly because it was the only shade of kind of soft plum that I really liked. When you smooth it on, it's very bright. Almost clown like. But blend it onto the apples of your cheeks, along the cheekbones and toward the hairline, and it turns into just the perfect pop of color. That's exactly what I was looking for. You can layer on more to amp up the impact, but I think it's a perfect product for an every day look. Just a little goes a long way. You can smooth it on lids and lips, too, but I don't do use it for that.

review_content: My skin is aging and dry, this adds just the right amount of natural color. Blond with light skin and love Ample Apple.

product_name: CLINIQUE Chubby Stick Cheek Colour Balm
user_specs: ['Age 18-24', 'Skin Type Combination', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Eye Color Brown']
review_content:
My powder blush hasn't been sitting well on my face recently, so I decided to switch to a cream balm since I had heard great reviews about them. I was hesitant at first with buying something I'd never tried before, and even more so when I received it. I purchased the color '02 Robust Rhubarb' and was expecting a coral color. However, the color is much more pink than expected. It is sheen and gives off great color, it's also incredibly blendable which is what I love. But my cheeks are red enough as it is, and although the pink tones don't add to it, it was certainly a cause for concern since I didn't want to add redness. This product is good in terms of use and functionality, but the color doesn't correlate to the description.

I recently decided to give this a try due to getting a bit older and wanting more nourishing makeup for my face that would keep a more dewy look (I have combo skin). I got the COLOR 02 Robust Rhubarb - blushing peach and I really like it! A little bit goes a long way and it adds a healthy flush to my cheeks. I wonder how it will hold up to the upcoming summer humidity...I hope it does as I really like the color on my fair freckled cheeks :-)

product_name: CLINIQUE Chubby Stick Cheek Colour Balm
review_content: Roly Poly Rosy is a great natural makeup color for simple days. Blends easily, and also looks great if you put a tiny amount on your lips!

product_name: CLINIQUE Chubby Stick Cheek Colour Balm
review_content: I am fair-skinned & was looking for a natural-looking blush. The chubby stick in peony is perfect; subtle, a soft muted pink & is easily blended. So convenient & easy control how much color you want. Very natural & reasonably priced.

product_name: CLINIQUE Chubby Stick Cheek Colour Balm
review_content:
This blush is a staple in my makeup bag, and it deserves 5 stars! I bought this about 8 months ago when I wanted something easy for my makeup on vacation to Hawaii. Since then, I have used this Chubby Stick in Peony EVERY DAY. It blends well, looks sheer, feels great. No adverse reactions (even with sweaty, humid weather and sunscreen). Huge amount of product. I usually apply this cream blush over foundation, then follow with powder and powder contour/blush/highlighter. However, you don't have to layer or make things complicated. It's fine to just apply, blend, and apply a little more if you want to take it up a notch. Peony is a great mauve-plum color and I think it looks very natural on my NC35 skin. It also shows up when I am tan (NC45), but I would apply more product. I wish Clinique made more adventurous colors, but I suppose that is part of their marketing strategy-- simplicity for women in a hurry. I will definitely repurchase when this runs out... someday. :)

review_content: This is a great, creamy blush that's convenient for travel. I added just a splotch to each cheek and used my fingers to warm and blend. I have medium brown (Indian) skin and the roly posy tint worked well for me.

review_content: This is so beautiful when first applied, then within minutes it is gone. Its odd because I have dry skin and usually products dont melt away or absorb, but this just disappears!

review_content: Perfect subtle color for going to work and just wanting a pop of pink/purple. I put it on the skin directly then just blended it with a blush brush. Flawless application.

product_name: CLINIQUE Chubby Stick Cheek Colour Balm
user_specs: ['Age 25-34', 'Skin Type Dry', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Eye Color Hazel']
review_title: Easy to apply & just the right amount of color!
review_content: I was looking for a creme blush that was easy to apply and still left a good color. I tried a few other products, but those seemed to be either or. This product is BOTH! I have fair skin and I really love the Rosy Poly color. It looks really natural!

product_name: CLINIQUE Chubby Stick Cheek Colour Balm
user_specs: ['Age 25-34', 'Skin Type Oily', 'Skin Tone Olive', 'Eye Color Brown']
review_content: I've used many different kinds of blush over the years -- powder, gel, liquid, sticks -- and this one is by far my favorite. It looks so natural and sheer, and you can easily build it up for a more intense color. It also lasts for a long time, which is more than I can say for some of the other blushes I've used. It also works well even on my super oily face!

product_name: CLINIQUE Chubby Stick Cheek Colour Balm
review_content: This is the easiest, natural looking blush I've ever used! It's so easy to just dab on, rub in with finger tips and that's it! It gives a really natural flush and looks so pretty. Also, it lasts all day. I'm a convert!

product_name: CLINIQUE Chubby Stick Cheek Colour Balm

product_name: CLINIQUE Chubby Stick Cheek Colour Balm
user_specs: ['Age 35-44', 'Skin Type Normal', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Eye Color Brown']
review_content: I have tried & tried to pull off blush but have always looked like a 5 year old playing with Mom's make-up. For some reason I just couldn't wear blush properly. I picked this up in Am'd Up Apple and applied it in big circles to front of my cheeks (like a creepy doll at halloween time) and blend it in/up with my fingers. It looks great! I can finally wear blush that looks natural.

product_name: CLINIQUE Chubby Stick Cheek Colour Balm
review_content: This is the first cream blush stick I've ever tried, and I am pleasantly surprised :-). It's very easy to use, and the packaging is super cute! The color is easy to apply and blends easily. The rosy flush is beautiful on my pale skin and really brightens it up. I got this in a free gift, but I will purchase in the future.

product_name: CLINIQUE Chubby Stick Cheek Colour Balm

review_content: what i love about this blush stick is that it has the consistency inbetween cream and powder. I do want some glow on my cheek but only slightly, not the dewy look which many cream blush tends to do. It's gives me a very natural looking light flush, and it is very light weight, I don't get sense of stickiness on my cheeks. The only thing is it's not so generous in terms of shades.

product_name: CLINIQUE Chubby Stick Cheek Colour Balm
user_specs: ['Age 25-34', 'Skin Type Combination', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Eye Color Brown']
review_title: Easy to apply and Blends Well
review_content: The robust rhubarb looks really good on pale peach toned skin. It looks naturally flawless - like I naturally have peachy flushed cheeks. I'm tired of bronzers - and this gives enough color - that there is no need for one. I also bought this for my mom - who first got me the chubby stick lipstick - which is great as well. Definitely a new fan of Clinique,

product_name: CLINIQUE Chubby Stick Cheek Colour Balm
user_specs: ['Age 25-34', 'Skin Type Combination', 'Skin Tone Medium']
review_content:
I've tried a lot of cream blushes and this is my favorite. First of all, I like that it comes in a stick vs. a regular pan. You still need to blend it with your fingers a bit, but you can apply it directly to your cheeks instead of having to dip your fingers in the product and then pat it on your cheeks. The wash of color is just right - not too dramatic but still noticeable. It blends really well and the color is build-able. This is the perfect blush to use on no makeup/minimal makeup days. I did not purchase this intending to use over foundation, setting powder, etc. so I cannot attest to if it moves the product underneath. It has no shimmer/glitter (unlike Nars The Multiple). It has no smell like some others I've tried (I'm looking at you Josie Maran and Tarte). It's not sticky/tacky feeling (again Tarte), nor is it greasy or shiny. It lasts just as long as any other regular blush. Best cream blush in my opinion.

review_title: So natural and super easy to use!
review_content: This is a great blush. I have fair/light skin and I use the Amp'd Up Apple and it looks very natural on my cheeks. And so easy to use! It blends really well and it stays on pretty much all day. A little goes a long way which makes this chubby an excellent value!

product_name: CLINIQUE Chubby Stick Cheek Colour Balm
review_content: I usually don't do well with blush unless it's powder, but this got good reviews so I had to try it. I do really like it. Very pretty and natural. It can be over done easily, so start with a small amount and keep adding. I am oily and I found the color lasted all day. Also, it wore well over my powder foundation.

product_name: CLINIQUE Chubby Stick Cheek Colour Balm
user_specs: ['Age 25-34', 'Skin Type Normal', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Eye Color Hazel']
review_content: I have been using my chubby stick for months and I'm obsessed. I blend it with a stippling brush, it goes on very smooth and blends easily. The color lasts all day. Sometimes I will even put it on my lips! It's the perfect shade!
